intro: Ardisia tuberculata, commonly known as the waxy begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, red or orange berries. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its tuberculate (wart-like) stems and clustered inflorescences are distinctive botanical features. Ardisia tuberculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
